title: Thursday was a historically strange day in the stock market. That may be good news
content: The Russell 2000 small-cap index jumped more than 3% on Thursday, but every one of the so-called "Magnficient 7" stocks fell.
summary: The Russell 2000 small-cap index jumped more than 3% on Thursday, but every one of the so-called "Magnficient 7" stocks fell.

title: Japan's yen surges after U.S. inflation data as traders monitor possible intervention
content: The dollar lost around 2% against the Japanese yen on Thursday as the market was suddenly jolted by fresh inflation U.S. data.
summary: The dollar lost around 2% against the Japanese yen on Thursday as the market was suddenly jolted by fresh inflation U.S. data.

title: Delta says the Olympics will cost it $100 million as travelers skip Paris
content: Delta says travelers are opting for other destinations or booking outside of the dates of the Olympic Games.
summary: Delta says travelers are opting for other destinations or booking outside of the dates of the Olympic Games.

title: CNBC's Inside India newsletter: Modi in Moscow. What’s new?
content: The meeting is likely to have set tempers to boiling point in Washington, D.C., where the NATO military alliance was convening at the same time.
summary: The meeting is likely to have set tempers to boiling point in Washington, D.C., where the NATO military alliance was convening at the same time.

title: Inflation falls 0.1% in June from prior month, helping case for lower rates
content: The monthly inflation rate dipped for the first time in more than four years, providing further cover for the Fed to start lowering rates later this year.
summary: The monthly inflation rate dipped for the first time in more than four years, providing further cover for the Fed to start lowering rates later this year.

title: Tesla shares close down 8% after report of robotaxi unveiling delay
content: Tesla is reportedly pushing back the unveiling of its self-driving taxi to October from August.
summary: Tesla is reportedly pushing back the unveiling of its self-driving taxi to October from August.

title: Biden 'needs to drop out' campaign official says, more Democrats in Congress agree
content: President Joe Biden has refused to quit his campaign for a second term, but his debate performance against Donald Trump continues fueling Democratic panic.
summary: President Joe Biden has refused to quit his campaign for a second term, but his debate performance against Donald Trump continues fueling Democratic panic.

title: NATO condemns China as a 'decisive enabler' of Russia's war in Ukraine in most serious rebuke to date
content: NATO labeled Beijing a "decisive enabler" of Russia's war in Ukraine and expressed concern over Beijing's "systemic challenges" to the coalition's security.
summary: NATO labeled Beijing a "decisive enabler" of Russia's war in Ukraine and expressed concern over Beijing's "systemic challenges" to the coalition's security.

title: Britain's largest water utility placed under special measures as it grapples with $20 billion debt pile
content: Regulators gave Thames Water permission to raise customer bills by an average £99 annually over the next five years, nearly half of what it asked for.
summary: Regulators gave Thames Water permission to raise customer bills by an average £99 annually over the next five years, nearly half of what it asked for.

title: U.S. cities are sinking. Here's what that means for homeowners
content: Home values in areas with high land subsidence could drop 8.1%, according to forthcoming research. It's not the only way sinking surfaces could affect consumers.
summary: Home values in areas with high land subsidence could drop 8.1%, according to forthcoming research. It's not the only way sinking surfaces could affect consumers.

title: Apple reaches deal with EU regulators to open up mobile payments system to rivals
content: EU antitrust chief Margrethe Vestager said the European Commission accepted commitments from Apple to open access to its tap and go payments tech to rivals.
summary: EU antitrust chief Margrethe Vestager said the European Commission accepted commitments from Apple to open access to its tap and go payments tech to rivals.

title: Pfizer moves forward with once-daily version of weight loss pill after setbacks
content: The company plans to conduct studies in the second half of the year evaluating multiple doses of the drug.
summary: The company plans to conduct studies in the second half of the year evaluating multiple doses of the drug.

title: Macron breaks his silence on France's election earthquake as post-vote deadlock continues
content: French President Emmanuel Macron broke his silence on the political earthquake that took place in France last weekend.
summary: French President Emmanuel Macron broke his silence on the political earthquake that took place in France last weekend.

title: UK economy returns to growth in May, beating expectations as British pound hits four-month high
content: UK gross domestic product figures for May were published Thursday.

title: China's robotaxi push sparks concerns about job security for drivers
content: China's yearslong effort to develop robotaxis is starting to gain traction with consumers — and rattling taxi drivers who are worried about losing their jobs
summary: China's yearslong effort to develop robotaxis is starting to gain traction with consumers — and rattling taxi drivers who are worried about losing their jobs

title: Key inflation report looms on Thursday as traders grow more confident in Fed rate cut
content: The June consumer price index will be released Thursday, with traders eyeing September for the Federal Reserve's first rate cut.
summary: The June consumer price index will be released Thursday, with traders eyeing September for the Federal Reserve's first rate cut.

title: Treasury, IRS announce 'major milestone' of $1 billion in past-due taxes collected from millionaires
content: The U.S. Department of the Treasury and IRS announced a "major milestone" of collecting more than $1 billion in past-due taxes from millionaires.
summary: The U.S. Department of the Treasury and IRS announced a "major milestone" of collecting more than $1 billion in past-due taxes from millionaires.

title: JPMorgan is bullish on this Southeast Asian country, cites opportunities in data centers
content: The investment bank upgraded Malaysia to "neutral" from "underweight" last week, raising its target for the Kuala Lumpur Composite Index.
summary: The investment bank upgraded Malaysia to "neutral" from "underweight" last week, raising its target for the Kuala Lumpur Composite Index.

title: Japan is worried about another 'transactional' Trump presidency, Tokyo-based expert says
content: The Japanese government was "pretty certain that Biden had this well in hand." However, the ruling LDP is now reappraising the odds of a "Trump 2.0 presidency."

title: Samsung to launch upgraded voice assistant Bixby this year with its own AI
content: Samsung will launch an upgraded version of its voice assistant Bixby this year based on its own artificial intelligence models, mobile chief TM Roh told CNBC.
summary: Samsung will launch an upgraded version of its voice assistant Bixby this year based on its own artificial intelligence models, mobile chief TM Roh told CNBC.

title: Bill Gross says Tesla is the new meme stock
content: Longtime investor Bill Gross believes Elon Musk's Tesla is behaving like a speculative play among retail investors.

title: Shares of Stellar Blade maker Shift Up surge almost 50% on trading debut

content: A Japanese navy destroyer entered Chinese territorial waters recently in spite of repeated warnings, local news reported.

title: Man caught attempting to smuggle 104 live snakes in his pants at China border

title: As NATO meets, leaders look to 'Trump-proof' the military alliance
content: As NATO meets in Washington, the alliance is facing familiar foes and challenges. The prospect of another Donald Trump presidency is one of them.
